{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall lead and coordinate Federal and State emergency response efforts with respect
			 to propane supply emergencies in any State or region of the United States
			 that are characterized, as determined by the

text.#text: The
sudden increases in consumer prices for propane; or
propane supply shortages that threaten public safety or livestock safety.
In carrying out subsection (a), the
establish criteria to determine when an emergency response action would be triggered;

establish a system for forecasting and tracking the availability of propane, with an emphasis on
			 predicting supply shortages;

establish a system for alerting other Federal agencies, States, industry groups, and appropriate
			 stakeholders of the crisis—
before an emergency; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: determines that an emergency has occurred;

text.#text: when the

establish a plan for coordinated response to an emergency by Federal and State agencies using their
			 existing authorities; and
establish criteria to determine when the emergency has ended.

An emergency response carried out under this section may include actions by Federal and State
			 agencies using their existing authorities—
to protect consumers from unfair pricing;

to expedite the distribution of propane through available transportation modes, including
			 provisions—
to exempt motor carriers of propane from hours-of-service restrictions;
to prioritize propane shipments by rail;
to exempt vessels carrying propane from United States-flag ship requirements under the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to prioritize propane shipments over other shipments in batched
			 pipelines; and

text.#text: for actions by the
expedited release of energy assistance funds.
Nothing in this section limits any existing agency authority of a Federal agency.
